assignment.title: Capstone Project: Design and Implement a Generative Model
assignment.objective: Apply all skills and knowledge gained from the course to develop a comprehensive generative model project.
expectedCapabilities: Implement a generative model using suitable frameworks
assignment.submissionInstructions: Submit a zip file containing your proposal, source code, and final presentation slides to the course portal.

tasks.title: Submit Project Proposal
tasks.description: Develop and submit a comprehensive project proposal for feedback.

tasks.title: Submit Project Code and Report
tasks.description: Complete the project implementation, testing and submit the code along with a detailed project report.

steps.title: Select a Project Topic
steps.description: Identify and finalize a topic for your capstone project.

steps.title: Develop a Project Proposal
steps.description: Create a detailed proposal outlining your project's objectives, methodologies, and expected outcomes.

steps.title: Implement the Project
steps.description: Design and implement the generative model as per your proposal.

steps.title: Test and Evaluate
steps.description: Conduct thorough testing and evaluation of your implemented model.

steps.title: Prepare Final Presentation
steps.description: Summarize your project journey and present your findings.

checkForUnderstanding.question: What is the first step in the capstone project?
Why is evaluation crucial in project implementation?
options: It provides data insights on model performance
checkForUnderstanding.answer: It provides data insights on model performance

checkForUnderstanding.question: What should a project presentation include?

subsections.title: Understanding the Capstone Project
subsections.content: The capstone project represents the culmination of all the topics you have learned throughout the Generative AI Course. You will be tasked to design and implement a generative model project of your choice. This section explores possible project ideas and outlines the key objectives.

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of the capstone project in this course?
options: To apply all learned skills practically
To learn a new programming language
quizzes.answer: To apply all learned skills practically

subsections.title: Project Ideas and Proposal Development
subsections.content: In this subsection, we explore various generative model project ideas, including but not limited to image synthesis, text generation, and audio transformation. Students will learn how to develop a project proposal that clearly outlines their project goals, methodologies, and expected outcomes.

quizzes.question: What should be included in a project proposal?

subsections.title: Technical Implementation Framework
subsections.content: Students will be guided on how to set up a technical framework for their capstone project. This includes selecting appropriate tools and libraries for implementing their generative model, setting up a version control system for their code, and defining the development timelines.
codeExamples:
# Setup for Generative Adversarial Network
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.keras import layers

quizzes.question: Which of the following is crucial for a successful technical implementation?

subsections.title: Execution and Testing Strategies
subsections.content: This subsection focuses on the execution phase of the project. It discusses best practices for data handling, model training, tuning strategies, and testing methodologies to ensure your generative model performs as expected.
codeExamples:
# Example: Model evaluation
accuracy = model.evaluate(test_data, test_labels)
print(accuracy)

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of model testing?

subsections.title: Presentation and Reflection
subsections.content: In the concluding part of the capstone project, you'll prepare a presentation summarizing your project's journey, highlighting your project’s challenges, and reflecting on the knowledge you’ve gained throughout the course. This section will cover presentation best practices and reflection techniques.

quizzes.question: Why is reflection important in a project?
